content: Comcast uses yahoo these days. What provider is the second you are adding. If it is also a yahoo one, clear the cache and cookies in settings before moving forward. Yahoo reuse existing cookies that can cause issues.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Try this; it preserves your whole existing setup.

1. Copy TB files from the old PC

- launch TB on the old PC

- go to TB menu > Help > Troubleshooting Information

- click the Application Basics > Profile Folder 'Open Folder' button

- the profile folder will open

- navigate three levels up to the AppData\Roaming folder

- close TB

- copy the AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird folder to a flash drive

---

2. Paste the copied TB files to the new PC

- open the AppData\Roaming folder on the new PC like you did above

- delete the Thunderbird folder

- replace it with the Thunderbird folder from the flash drive

- launch TB
creator: siffemoz

content: IMAP syncs from the server. I suggest you restore that inbox to Local Folders and then COPY (not move) to the actual inbox

U kunt dit doen door uw adresboek te selecteren, dan op uw rechtermuisknop te klikken om het contextmenu te openen en vervolgens ‘Adresboek exporteren’ te kiezen. Volg vervolgens de instructies.

E-mailberichten kunt u exporteren door de te exporteren berichten te selecteren, met uw rechtermuisknop te klikken en Opslaan als… te kiezen.

content: please post screenshot of error message at the time the message is generated. Please translate the content of message to English. thank you. REMINDER: in GMX accounts, you must FIRST authorize the account to be used in IMAP or POP. Attempting to do that without first making that setting from within the online account will cause the problem you are seeing.
creator: davidsk

content: More information is needed. I suggest you check for mail at your online account. If messages are there and not on thunderbird, there may be a configuration error. If you are receiving error messages when messages are on the server, please post full content of message. thank you
